channel.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
channel.description:
I was surfing the net and I came across this blog post. http://devnulled.com/content/2007/01/how-to-make-ubuntu-linux-faster/
Which lead me to a great tweaks page. http://tvease.net/wiki/index.php?title=Tweak_ubuntu_for_speed
Enjoy! :)

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t think there is a set date, from what I can tell they are going to be trying to phase it in over the next few years. Some ISPs already use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

anyone know the date it will be the standerd? That would be awsome if next year they were using IPv6

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:9, topic:136566”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=188092.msg1710935#msg1710935 date=1188356187]

I don’t see why anyone would want a gay IPv6 address like this:

0db8:ab34:0778:7890:0040:1428:57ab

when you could have a nice looking, easy to remember IPv4 like this:

76.16.123.456

Because in the near future there won’t be enough of the second one to go around?
[/quote]
I don’t see why they can’t just add another block and get 16,581,375 more.[/quote]

They are adding a few more ‘blocks’ so they don’t have to change it every year.

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

io9, they are trying to look really far ahead into the future and make damn sure that they won’t have to add any more blocks for a long long long long time.

Plus, why do you care? lol. It looks more complicated, but you won’t have to worry about it. Of course, you won’t be able to remember your IP anymore, but a quick ifconfig in linux or ipconfig in windows and you can figure it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:136566”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=188092.msg1710376#msg1710376 date=1188341457]
I don’t see why anyone would want a gay IPv6 address like this:

0db8:ab34:0778:7890:0040:1428:57ab

when you could have a nice looking, easy to remember IPv4 like this:

76.16.123.456
[/quote]

Because in the near future there won’t be enough of the second one to go around?[/quote]
I don’t see why they can’t just add another block and get 16,581,375 more.

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Same here. Isn’t around 99% of networks still using IPv4? I’m surprised this hasn’t been disabled by default.

Another good tweak is to install this kernel. It worked fine on my computer and Ubuntu did run faster.
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=311158

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:4, topic:136566”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=188092.msg1698326#msg1698326 date=1187990552]
Are they finally coming to their senses and disabling that horrid IPv6?
[/quote]

!?!?!? IPv6 is the future of the internet! wtf are you talking about!?[/quote]

BUT when it is enabled and running on current networks with routers and hardware that don’t understand IPv6 it makes things horribly slow. I had to disable mine as well.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Are they finally coming to their senses and disabling that horrid IPv6?

I also Lol’d at this quote from the comments on the first article:

Honestly it seems like Linux hasn’t been very friendly to AMD lately, so I’ve been back in Intel-land for the past several years.

Read full topic

item.title: Tweaks to speed up Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I was surfing the net and I came across this blog post.

devnulled

How To Make Ubuntu Linux Faster

I came across a page from the TvEase wiki the other day via Digg which specified a few tweaks on how to make Ubuntu speedier. As far as I can tell, they mostly do a few things like toning down memory swapping to disk (hmm, academically that kind of...

Which lead me to a great tweaks page.
http://tvease.net/wiki/index.php?title=Tweak_ubuntu_for_speed

Enjoy!

Read full topic
